cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.geneticalgorithm
Class GeneticAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
  cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.BaseAlgorithm
      cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm.geneticalgorithm.GeneticAlgorithm
All Implemented Interfaces:
Algorithm
public class GeneticAlgorithm
extends BaseAlgorithm

Genetic Algorithm implementation using tournament selection, one point crossover reproduction and random mutation.

Starts with random population (with given size) and in every iteration creates new population from previous one. Individuals to become parents are randomly selected from population based on their fitness such that higher fitness means higher chance of became parent. Two parents produces two children, which could be possibly mutated. Repeating this creates new population.

Selection method is used tournament selection, reproduction is one point crossover. Mutation (if happens) changes one configuration variable to a random value (in min/max bounds).

populationSize

protected int populationSize
Number of chromosomes in population. Must be even and larger than 1.

mutationRate

protected double mutationRate
Chance of offspring being mutated.

0.0 means no chance, 1.0 means always mutate.

Constructor Detail

GeneticAlgorithm

public GeneticAlgorithm(int populationSize,
                        double mutationRate)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates new GA with given mutation rate and population size.

Parameters:
populationSize - number of chromosomes in each generation (must be even and larger than 1)
mutationRate - rate of mutation, number between 0.0 (no mutation) and 1.0 (always mutate)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if population size is not even or larger than 1
Method Detail

init

public void init(ObjectiveProblem problem)
          throws InvalidProblemException
Description copied from interface: Algorithm
Initializes new Algorithm on a problem.

Algorithm is expected to prepare its fitness at this point, since solver can override it afterwards.

Also, keep in mind that one algorithm could be used repeatedly on several different problems, so init should reset all local settings.

Parameters:
problem - problem to be initialized on
Throws:
InvalidProblemException - if supplied problem cannot be solved by this algorithm
